title: Electric force - 2x a charge and half the

content.question: Two small spheres have charges of the same magnitude. They are separated by a distance <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> and exert electrostatic forces of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> on each other. The distance between the spheres is then halved and the charge on one of the spheres is doubled. The spheres now exert electrostatic forces of magnitude <math alttext="F sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> on each other. What is the ratio <math alttext="the fraction F sub 2 over F sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><msub><mi>F</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mfrac></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
